{"title": "Sherlock Holmes: Nemesis", "title_search": "sherlock holmes nemesis", "title_keyword": "sherlock holmes nemesis", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/sherlock-holmes-nemesis/", "summary": "(Also known as \"Sherlock Holmes versus Ars\u00e8ne Lupin\")  Having grappled with the machinations of a cult of Cthulhu in his last PC adventure, the world's greatest detective is now ready to challenge Ars\u00e8ne Lupin, the gentleman thief. Lupin, a character invented by renowned French writer Maurice Leblanc, has thrilled millions of readers worldwide with his exploits, and proves a perfect foil for Sherlock Holnmes. This new Sherlock Holmes game sends players to 19th Century London where Ars\u00e8ne Lupin, a young French burglar with an impressive track record, has just challenged Scotland Yard and the most famous of detectives - Sherlock Holmes. Lupin has announced that he plans to rob the capital of five objects of immense value over the course of five days. The objects are housed in highly prestigious locations such as the National Gallery, the British Museum, the Tower of London and even Buckingham Palace! Sherlock Holmes will have to muster all his courage and ingenuity to save England from terrible humiliation. The game invites you to visit 19th century London in all its splendor and to travel through superb decors which have been faithfully reproduced with the game's 3D engine. With famous places and some of the most prestigious landmarks as your playing field, it is as if you are on your own guided tour of one of Europe's most fabulous cities. If the pace of the adventure and its many surprises leaves you breathless, take a break and enjoy looking at the hundreds of works of art, all faithfully reproduced in their real locations. {"title": "Card Ninja", "title_search": "card ninja", "title_keyword": "card ninja", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/card-ninja/", "summary": "Card Ninja is a radically different type of card game. It's an action puzzle that is a perfect mix of fun and excitement. The critics love Card Ninja and so will you. Featured as a "New and Notable" app by Apple " this will probably be the best game you've played in a long time, not just on the iPhone" --Softpedia "an instant classic" --Appvee "Card Ninja is original, creative, affordable, simple to figure out, and yet still challenging to play. Here at SlapApp we consider those to be ideal ingredients for a successful app." --SlapApp “Flicking cards feels really natural in Card Ninja. The controls are spot on, and when I miss it is my own fault. I love it when a game manages to mimic natural motions this well.” --iPhone Games Network "this is a very unique and cool game, great audio, and special effects." --CrazyMikesapps.com "It’s great for quick bursts of gaming, which is perfect for the iPhone." --LootNinja.com Recommended app --iPhoneapplicationlist "Worthwhile app" --Appcraver "..it’s like Tetris on steroids" --Sardy Don't forget to check out the official demo video on YouTube. http://bit.ly/CmyWj ---------------------------------------- Card Ninja features unique game play in which you flick cards at matching targets, balancing speed with accuracy as you try to improve your Ninja ranking. Card Ninja begins as a deceptively simple matching game with killer sound effects and a fast tempo. As you progress you are confronted by challenging matching combinations, dynamic targets and out of control wild cards. This addictive game will soon become a test of your peripheral vision, short-term memory and the key Ninja skill, your finger flicking speed. The only question is – Do you have the Nunchaks to meet the challenge? * Flick cards from the deck at targets, matching colors, symbols or both. * Earn bonuses for beating the timer. * Take care to hit targets and avoid causing chaos in the Dojo kitchen. * Gather enough cards to progress to higher levels and earn a higher Ninja ranking. * 'Good’ wildcards offer card bonuses while 'Evil' wildcards can inflict extreme damage to your card count – learn their clues well and you may succeed. ------ We are hearing about a bug related to Open Feint and access to the high scores screen. This appears to be an issue on devices running 2.2.1 only. A fix is on the way. Note that this does not affect general game play only the ability to see high scores. If you see this problem on other versions of the OS or have a different problem please send us an email rather than putting your issue in your iTunes review. That way we can contact you to better understand the problem and work on a fix.", "genre": ["Adventure"], "metascore": 0, "critic_reviews": 0, "user_score": 0, "user_reviews": 0, "release_date": "2009-05-07", "images": ["https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-117378-17.jpg", "https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-117378-17.jpg"], "video": null, "video_thumbnail": null, "video_type": null, "sentiment": null, "must_play": false, "crew": null, "countries": ["North America"], "companies": ["Pint Sized Mobile (Developer)", "Pint Sized Mobile (Publisher)"], "platforms": ["iOS (iPhone/iPad)"], "rating": null}

{"title": "Cosmic One", "title_search": "cosmic one", "title_keyword": "cosmic one", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/cosmic-one/", "summary": "Cosmic One!  The puzzle game genre distilled into a pure, insanely addictive form. Simple intuitive controls and fiendishly addictive gameplay that takes full advantage of your device. {"title": "Atomicity", "title_search": "atomicity", "title_keyword": "atomicity", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/atomicity/", "summary": "Atomicity is a very addicting transport puzzle game.  The objective is to assemble the molecules shown using the atoms on the board. Sounds simple, huh? The part where this seemingly easy task gets more difficult, is that once an atom starts moving in one direction, it will continue moving until it hits another atom, or a wall.  Features:  - 60 Levels of varying difficulty - 20 Bonus Levels - Auto Save (if you stop in the middle of a game, you can pick right back up where you left off) - Sound Enable/Disable - Statistics - Undo - Pause - Board Reset (if you get stuck and want to start over)  Objective:  Reassemble the molecule shown in the example window (pay attention to the connectors between the atoms)  How to Play:  - Tap on an atom on the playing surface to select it. It will display the possible directions it can move using yellow arrows.  - Use the Directional arrows on the right of the screen (under the example window) to move an atom (only the valid direction will "light up"). - An atom can only move in one direction at a time. - Atoms will continue moving in the chosen direction until they hit another atom or a wall. - The next set of 6 levels (plus 2 bonus levels) are unlocked when all the previous levels (not including the bonus levels) are completed.  Tips: - You can undo your latest moves by clicking on the Undo button - You can reset the move count, board, and timer to their initial values by clicking on the Reset button - Pay attention to the connectors between atoms", "genre": ["Puzzle"], "metascore": 0, "critic_reviews": 0, "user_score": 0, "user_reviews": 0, "release_date": "2009-05-12", "images": ["https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-116733-17.jpg", "https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-116733-17.jpg"], "video": null, "video_thumbnail": null, "video_type": null, "sentiment": null, "must_play": false, "crew": null, "countries": ["North America"], "companies": ["Mobile Novelties (Developer)", "Mobile Novelties (Publisher)"], "platforms": ["iOS (iPhone/iPad)"], "rating": null}

{"title": "Gun Runner Mafia", "title_search": "gun runner mafia", "title_keyword": "gun runner mafia", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/gun-runner-mafia/", "summary": "Gun Runner is a trading game, inspired by the trading games  on vintage platforms such as Dopewars.   The basic rules of trading apply. Buy low, sell high. What's cheap in one city may be expensive in another.   You’ll need to fund your operations by borrowing money. But be careful, the cost of borrowing in this world can be very high so you'll need to know the cost of goods to keep ahead of those interest charges…  To make progress you'll need to aim high. Borrow as much as you can get but only when you know what you’re going to buy and that you're getting a good price. The interest rates are non negotiable and the penalties are harsh.   And by the way the Interpol is after you. There’s nothing you can do about that, that’s the cost of doing business.  ---------------------------------  Thought a look behind the scenes might interest some of you. Below is the a snippet of code that controls some of the game variables. {"title": "Carpet", "title_search": "carpet", "title_keyword": "carpet", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/carpet/", "summary": "A new take on the card game you know and love… Solitaire.  The object of the game is to discard all cards to the foundations where the aces have already been dealt. All cards from “the Carpet” must be moved to the foundations upwards by suit (i.e. 2 over A). Any “holes on the carpet,” or gaps left behind by the cards that have been moved to the foundations, are filled by cards from the waste pile. PANDORUM is the official movie game for the theatrical released sci-fi action thriller starring Ben Foster and Dennis Quaid.
